Emergency Defense: Arms flail upward chaotically, blade position erratic, shoulders hunch defensively
Move Backwards: Hips pull backward, torso leans away, back leg muscles tense
Parry: Blade begins moving deliberately to specific line (high/low, left/right), shoulders adjust to brace for impact
Deflection: Blade moves with purpose to SPECIFIC angle (clearly committing to one attack type), hips rotate to optimal deflection position

Emergency Defense: Fighter stumbles, off-balance, vulnerable (already in recovery)
Move Backwards: Front foot lifts, clear backward movement, blade maintains guard but disengages
Parry: Blade positioned on interception line, arms locked/braced, clear defensive structure
Deflection: Blade at perfect intercept angle, body coiled for sweeping motion, point already aimed at opponent's opening

Emergency Defense: Deep recovery - regaining composure and stance
Move Backwards: Fighter lands at new distance, blade still up but no threat
Parry: Blades clash, both fighters in bind, pushing/testing for advantage
Deflection: Success moment: Blade makes minimal contact, opponent's weapon slides harmlessly aside, immediate riposte

Move Backwards: ANY time - need 0.6-0.8s before impact + space
Deflection: Attempt from Phase 1+; Succeeds only during opponent's Phase 4
